alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk; Southeast Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued December 18 at 3:28PM EST until December 18 at 6:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...1 1/2 to 2 1/2 ft of inundation above ground level is likely in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline with the Monday afternoon high tide. Locally 3 ft of inundation above ground level is possible. * WHERE...Northeast Suffolk and Southeast Suffolk Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 PM EST this evening. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Widespread flooding (up to 2 1/2 ft of inundation above ground level) of vulnerable areas is expected near the waterfront and shoreline, including roads, parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes and businesses with basements near the waterfront. Locally 3 ft of inundation above ground level is possible. Numerous road closures are likely, and vehicles parked in vulnerable areas near the waterfront will likely become flooded. Flooding will also extend inland from the waterfront along tidal rivers and bays. South facing shorelines of the north fork and areas around the entrance to Peconic River will be the most susceptible. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Large breaking waves along the ocean beach front of 12 to 16 ft will result in widespread beach flooding and dune erosion Monday morning into afternoon. Scattered overwashes are likely where dune structures are compromised, causing flooding of roadways and vulnerable structures behind them. For Orient Point, 4 to 8 ft breaking waves during the time of high tide Monday afternoon will likely result in beach erosion, minor damage to shorefront structures and flooding of shorefront roadways. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. PECONIC RIVER AT RIVERHEAD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.7 FT, MODERATE 6.4 FT, MAJOR 7.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.3 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 3.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 18/04 PM 6.2/ 6.8 2.8/ 3.4 3.2/ 3.7 2 MODERATE 19/05 AM 2.3/ 2.8 -1.1/-0.6 -0.9/-0.4 1 NONE 19/05 PM 2.6/ 3.1 -0.9/-0.4 -0.2/ 0.2 2 NONE ORIENT HARBOR AT ORIENT POINT NY MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
